Tools for Student Records Research

Source: R/midfieldr.R
midfieldr.Rd

A package for investigating data from the MIDFIELD database. Provides functions for manipulating student record data such as those provided in the midfielddata package, which provides a sample of student records from registrars at participating US universities, including demographic, term, course, and degree information for 97,640 undergraduate students from 1987 to 2016.

Source

Data provided by the MIDFIELD project: https://engineering.purdue.edu/MIDFIELD

Details

Provides functions to access and manipulate student record data. To illustrate the workflow, we would use these functions to compute and display a persistence metric such as "stickiness":

  • get_cip() to find the CIP codes of programs we want to study

  • label_programs() to isolate and label the 6-digit CIPs

  • get_enrollees() to gather students ever enrolled

  • get_graduates() to gather graduating students

  • get_race_sex() to gather student sex and race/ethnicity

  • order_multiway() to condition the multiway data for graphing

Operations such subsetting, joining, and grouping and summarizing are performed using one's preferred tools in base R or packages such as dplyr or data.table. In our examples, we use base R functions for data carpentry and ggplot2 for graphing.

Data

Instructional program data is provided in cip, a data frame of names and codes of academic programs from the 2010 IPEDS Classification of Instructional Programs (CIP) by the US Department of Education.

Student record data is provided in the companion data package, midfielddata. Data are provided in four datasets: midfieldcourses, midfielddegrees, midfieldstudents, and midfieldterms.

Contents

Developed by Richard Layton, Russell Long, Matthew Ohland, US National Science Foundation.
